SENT.plain: Macroglossia can cause a wide spectrum of problems in the pediatric population
Airway obstruction is the most severe of the sequelae and must be handled promptly
Typically, congenital macroglossia does not present with sudden airway obstruction, however, traumatic or postoperative macroglossia can
Iatrogenic postoperative macroglossia is presented and mechanisms of injury discussed
Preventative and therapeutic measures are outlined
